intro: Schubertia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered schubertia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to conserve water in its dry habitat. Schubertia multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and prolonged blooming period. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
